Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown, partly fired red; traces of two added white bands; exterior: part of two rising rays; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Rising rays are typically found on the lower body of Chian Wild Goat Style chalices but they disappear from the repertoire by circa 600BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0083) (phase 2)
